net.proteusframework.core.mail

Class EmailValidationService

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.mail.EmailValidationService

  • @Service
public class EmailValidationService
extends Object
    Service responsible for validating emails.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

      • EMAIL_DNS_VALIDATE

        public static final String EMAIL_DNS_VALIDATE
        Determines if DNS validation will be performed (A, MX). Defaults to true.

        public boolean isLimitedDomain(String addressOrDomain)
        Test if the specified address or domain is in the limited set of domains.
        Parameters:
        addressOrDomain - the address or domain.
        Returns:
        true if the domain is considered limited or the domain is an empty string.

      • isValidDomain

        public boolean isValidDomain(String addressOrDomain)
        Test if domain is valid for receiving email.
        Parameters:
        addressOrDomain - the email address or a domain. If it is a non-local email address, then the domain is checked. Local email addresses are not supported.
        Returns:
        true if the domain appears to be a valid domain for receiving email.

public void postConstruct()

        Set the Dnslookup. This is normally configured via spring.
        Parameters:

      • setEmailAddressValidator

        Set the email address validator. This is normally configured via spring.
        Parameters:

      • setLimitedRecipientDomains

        public void setLimitedRecipientDomains(@Nullable
                                       Collection<String> limitedRecipientDomains)
        Set the limited recipient domains. If set, only emails to these domains are allowed. This is normally configured via spring.
        Parameters:
        limitedRecipientDomains - the limited recipient domains.
